programmes.show_description: In 18th-century England, a farmer finds a deformed skull, sparking a sinister influence over the village's youth, who fall under the grip of a demonic force. Contains distressing scenes.
3/8. Seasoned floating homeowners Pat and Sue plan to spend their retirement on a state-of-the-art Dutch barge. But will their expensive tastes sink the project?
Archaeologists Alex and Peter and historian Ruth try Edwardian life for a year. The team branch out into market gardening, all-year-round egg production and beef cattle.
5/15. Rick immerses himself in north west England's food traditions at Britain's best market, enjoys memories of Manchester's music scene, and cooks an old favourite.

5/15. Rick immerses himself in north west England's food traditions at Britain's best market, enjoys memories of Manchester's music scene, and cooks an old favourite.
Comedy. The story of Great Train Robber Buster Edwards, a small-timer who fell in with more ambitious thieves. Phil Collins and Julie Walters star.
In this period caper, set in 1930s England, romance blooms between two very different people, an American thief and an Irish woman.
1/2. Holmes and Watson get embroiled in theft and murder as they try to guard the safe transport of the world's largest diamond. Christopher Lee stars.
2/2. Can Holmes and Watson foil a plot to steal the Star of Africa, the world's largest diamond, and deliver it back to King Edward VII in England? Christopher Lee stars.
Action. World War II. Allied commandos are parachuted into North Africa on a mission to infiltrate and hold an Axis-held fort until reinforcements arrive. Lee Van Cleef stars.
Comedy. A London cabbie gets into a series of personal and professional misadventures and scrapes with various - often married - women. Contains sex scenes.
It's Christmas Eve and six lonely people are looking to grab an elusive slice of enjoyment. Who better to contact than an escort agency. Contains sex scenes and distressing scenes.
Comedy. The story of Great Train Robber Buster Edwards, a small-timer who fell in with more ambitious thieves. Phil Collins and Julie Walters star.
The frank story of eight people's tempestuous relationship with alcohol - from first drink to rock bottom, we see what it took to get sober and build a new life in recovery.

Ronnie Barker stars as General Futtock, who has a motley group of guests stay at his country estate - and chaos ensues. Contains 70s social attitudes.
Comedy. Norman Wisdom stars as a bank manager who upends his square existence to join some youthful hippies. Will this new groovy energy bring the spark back to his marriage?
1/2. The epic story of Libyan leader Omar Mukhtar resisting Italian occupation in the 1930s. Can guerrillas beat Italian military might? Anthony Quinn and Ollie Reed star.
2/2. The epic tale of Libyan leader Omar Mukhtar concludes with relentless resistance to Italian conquest - through sacrifice and bloodshed. Anthony Quinn and Ollie Reed star.
Spy thriller. Promising Oxford University students are disappearing. An M15 investigation uncovers a pattern of accidents and arrests. Is the KGB involved? Terence Stamp stars.
Action. Pierce Brosnan plays a UN espionage expert who leads an elite team to recover a stolen Rembrandt masterpiece in this action sequel based on Alistair MacLean's novel.
Gordon Laid is a soldier returning to London after WW2. He gets mixed up in a series of murders and mistaken identities. Bawdy romp with Robin Askwith. Contains nudity and 70s social attitudes.
